com.compendium.core.db
Class DBAudit

java.lang.Object
  com.compendium.core.db.DBAudit

public class DBAudit
extends java.lang.Object

THIS CLASS IS CURRENTLY NOT USED AND THEREFORE ITS INTERFACE CANNOT BE GUARENTEED DBAudit defines the format for the saving audit information, for each record type, in the Audit table. The data of each record audited is stored as an XML String.

Author:
Michelle Bachler

addAudit

public static boolean addAudit(DBConnection dbcon,
                               java.lang.String sItemID,
                               java.lang.String sCategory,
                               int nAction,
                               java.lang.String sData)
                        throws java.sql.SQLException
Add a new audit record to the Audit table.

Parameters:
DBConnection - dbcon com.compendium.core.db.management.DBConnection, the DBConnection object to access the database with.
sItemID, - the id of object being audited.
sCategory, - the table name for the record type.
nAction, - the action type of this audit.
sData, - An XML string with the data of the record being audited.
Returns:
boolean, true if it was successful, else false.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

dbcon - the DBConnection object to access the database with.
nAction - the action type of this audit.
movie - the Movie being audited.
Returns:
boolean true if it was successful, else false.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

auditMovieProperties

public static boolean auditMovieProperties(DBConnection dbcon,
                                           int nAction,
                                           MovieProperties movie)
                                    throws java.sql.SQLException
